source_note: State baseline derived from Maryland Department of the Environment (MDE) recycling requirements and county programs.

organics.guidance: Food waste recycling required for large generators under HB 264; residential composting encouraged.
organics.bin: Green organics bin or compost drop-off.
organics.notes: Montgomery County and Baltimore offer curbside composting pilots.

paper_cardboard.guidance: Recycle clean paper and cardboard; flatten boxes.

glass_containers.guidance: Recycle bottles and jars (rinsed, no lids).

metal_containers.guidance: Recycle aluminum and steel/tin cans; rinse before placing in bin.

plastics.guidance: Recycle rigid plastics labeled #1–#7 depending on local acceptance.
plastics.notes: Plastic film and foam not accepted curbside.

beverage_containers_crv.guidance: Maryland has no statewide deposit system.

household_batteries.guidance: Recycle rechargeable and lead-acid batteries through collection programs.
household_batteries.notes: Keep batteries out of household trash.

e_waste.guidance: Electronics recycling required under Maryland E-Waste Program for manufacturers.
e_waste.bin: Drop-off at e-waste collection or HHW event.

plastic_bags_and_film.guidance: Plastic bags banned in Montgomery County and several localities.
plastic_bags_and_film.bin: Return film to store drop-offs; use reusable bags.

bulky_items.guidance: Schedule bulk pickup or drop-off at county waste facility.
bulky_items.notes: Fees and scheduling vary by county.
